title: Library Resource Utilization Strategy for Foreign Language Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Foreign Language Proficiency and Experience with Basic Library Utilization
context.additional_context: Presents foreign language learning methods integrating library print/digital resources for learners accustomed to smartphone-centric information search environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the three types of foreign language materials in the library collection: grammar, conversation, and culture.
Learners can search for materials in the target language using the library’s online catalog within 10 minutes.
Learners can select primary sources (newspapers, magazines) related to the lecture topic and organize a 5-minute presentation.

resources: Physical Materials in the Library’s Foreign Language Section
Sample Foreign Language Newspapers/Magazines in the Library’s Collection
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
